title: Azov-Don Bank
text:
Azov-Don Bank was one of the largest <a href="Joint-stock%20company">-stock</a> commercial banks in the <a href="Russian%20Empire">Russian Empire</a>. It was founded in 1871 in <a href="Taganrog">Taganrog</a> located on the shores of the <a href="Sea%20of%20Azov">Sea of Azov</a>. It became a major vehicle for French investment in the Russia Empire prior to the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a>. In 1905-6 French banks bought ten thousand shares in this bank. In 1912 The Azov-Don Bank invested in the French <a href="Banque%20des%20Pays%20du%20Nord">Banque des Pays du Nord</a>, with <a href="Boris%20Kamenka">Boris Kamenka</a> being appointed to the latter's board.
The Bank was nationalized shortly after the <a href="October%20Revolution">October Revolution</a> by a decree of the <a href="Council%20of%20People%27s%20Commissars">Council of People's Commissars</a> of the <a href="Russian%20Soviet%20Federative%20Socialist%20Republic">Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic</a> in December 1917.
